bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Carlton W. Werkau served as the Secretary-Treasurer for the Communications Workers of America (CWA) from 1943 until his death in 1955.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of photographs, both personal and union related, correspondence, and CWA records. The CWA records consist of Convention proceedings from 1953-1955 as well as a strike manual and tax files. Articles and letters concerning Werkau's death in 1955 are also included.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Carlton Werkau was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: A relative of Carlton W. Werkau sent these papers to the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) Regional Office in Winston-Salem, NC. The collection was later transferred from the NLRB to The Communications Workers of America (CWA), where Werkau had served as Secretary-Treasurer from 1943-1955.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by John L. Quinn, Communications Workers of America District Counsel, in 2010. The accession number associated with this gift is 2010.011.
